segments.text: I see the woman standing in front of the sink, lost in her own world of dish drying.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Despite the water spilling over, she remains blissfully unaware, a serene figure in a chaotic scene.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s hard to believe she hasn’t noticed the puddle growing beneath her feet, slowly widening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: There’s a part of me that admires her focus, but another part that worries for her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: What would happen if she slipped? It’s a genuine concern that gnaws at me.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I watch the boy teeter on the stool, his determination to reach the cookie jar both impressive and alarming.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: His little fingers stretch towards the jar, and I can’t help but smile at his eagerness.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Beside him, the girl stands expectantly, her palm up, waiting for her part of the treat.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Their innocent plotting is delightful, but the danger looms large with that stool so precarious.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It infuriates me that the woman, so busy with her plates, doesn’t see the hazards her children face.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Each second that passes feels stretched, like a slow-motion film where disaster is almost inevitable.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The sunlight pouring through the window serves as a reminder of how calm it seems outside, a stark contrast to the bubbling trouble inside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I find myself wanting to warn them, to shout and break the serene spell that envelops the moment.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: But all I can do is watch, tensing up as I anticipate the crash that I fear might come.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wish for a hint of awareness to dawn on the woman, for her to wake from her dish-drying reverie.
segments.speaker: PAR
